info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 21 at 12:08AM CDT until April 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Greene, Webster and Wright.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM CDT, River gauges and road closure reports show flooding in the area. Several inches of rain have fallen over the weekend. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Elk Creek at Highway Z, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, James River at Bell Ford Road and Howell Creek at County Road 9790. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Marshfield, Mountain Grove, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking, Rogersville, Cabool, Seymour, Mansfield, Fordland, Norwood, Hartville, Summersville, Niangua, Raymondville, Diggins, Dawson, Pomona, Duncan, South Fork, Brandsville, Huggins, Plato, Bendavis, Graff, Simmons, Elk Creek, Solo, Bucyrus, Manes, Success, Clear Springs, Roby, Yukon, Siloam Springs, Prescott, Hazelton and Odin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Greene, MO; Howell, MO; Texas, MO; Webster, MO; Wright, MO
